00054 // =============================================================================
00056 // This method must override the behavior of other Generators as it is not made of Generators
00057 std::string Constant :: getParameterString(bool compact)
00058 {
00059     // just return number
00060     if (compact) {
00061         return aw::numberToString(value_);
00062     }
00063     else {
00064         std::string str;
00065         str += getName();
00066         str += "{";   
00067     
00068         // abbreviated version; just have number alone
00069         str += aw::numberToString(value_);
00070     
00071         // only one parameter, so give condensed form
00072     //     str += aw::parameterNameToString(pValid_[0]);
00073     //     str += "{";
00074     // 
00075     //     // see function template here for alternative way to do this
00076     //     // http://notfaq.wordpress.com/2006/08/30/c-convert-int-to-string/
00077     //     std::stringstream out;
00078     //     out << value_; // convert value to string
00079     //     str += out.str();
00080     // 
00081     //     str += "}";
00082     
00083         str += "}";
00084         return str;
00085     }
00086 }

00090 // =============================================================================
00091 // Set the parameter of this Generator
00092 // As a Constant, this method must override Generator behavior to assing
00093 // value_ directly
00094 void Constant :: setParameter(const aw::ParameterName p, double v, 
00095                               aw::ParameterContext pc)
00096 {
00097     if (!isValidParameter(p)) {
00098         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid parameter for this generator");
00099     }
00100     bool match(false);
00101     switch (p) {                       
00102         case aw::pNameValue:     
00103             if (isValidContext(p, pc)) {
00104             // note: this Generator does not use the pMap_ map
00105             value_ = v;   
00106             match = true;
00107             break;              
00108             }
00109     }
00110     if (!match) {
00111         throw std::invalid_argument("invalid parameter name or parameter context");
00112     }    
00113 }

00117 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00118 // called from Generator, overloaded for Constant
00119 void Constant :: readParameterString(std::string& parameterString) {
00120 
00121     std::string str(parameterString); // get a copy of this string
00122     //std::cout << "Constant.readParameterString(): " << str << std::endl;
00123 
00124     // in some cases we will get just a number as parmeter string
00125     // if the are in the form value{3}
00126     bool pStrIsArgs = aw::canConvertFromStringToDouble(str); 
00127 
00128     if (pStrIsArgs) {
00129         setParameter(aw::pNameValue, 
00130                      aw::stringToDouble(parameterString));
00131     }
00132     else {
00133         // read in parameters; there can be only one
00134         std::string name(""); 
00135         std::string arguments("");
00136         std::string context("");
00137         std::string working("");
00138     
00139         aw::getFirstParameterTrio(str, name, arguments, context, working);
00140         // names here are parameter names; as strings, these will be converted
00141         // set parameter as double
00142         setParameter(aw::stringToParameterName(name), 
00143                      aw::stringToDouble(arguments));
00144     }
00145     
00146 }
